We collaborate closely with internal and external partners worldwide to mature our ability to utilize Cloud Service Providers. Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

The Senior WordPress Developer, CE Digital Marketing Channel IT is responsible for both back-end and front-end development, including creating WordPress themes and plugins across multiple WordPress VIP multi-sites. The candidate should have extensive experience with a combination of programming skills (namely PHP, HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript), strong content management skills, and a good eye for aesthetics. A strong understanding of industry trends and content management systems is desired, as well as the ability to identify opportunities to improve services, contribute ideas to coding best practices and new technologies, and liaison between business and technical teams.

Responsibilities

Development/Deployment of enterprise-level WordPress plugins and themes

Collaborating with developers from other teams to create modular, extensible PHP and JS solutions (plugins, packages, blocks, and components) for reuse across projects

Converting project requirements into proposals for implementation (estimating time/resources, planning tasks/timeline, etc)

Platform/multisite maintenance and optimization

Code Reviews and Feedback

Mentor junior developers and lead community of practitioners/developers

Work planning and issue management

Local Development Environment Setup/Configuration

Documentation and Coding Standards

Theme and Plugin Security

Comfortable wearing many hats and willing to work on all parts of the stack

Education

Bachelor Degree preferred

Qualifications

5+ plus years of working experience in Web Development

3+ years of working experience in WordPress development (multisite, configuration, parent/child themes, plugins, Gutenberg)

Expert at writing PHP (object-oriented, dependency injection, etc)

Experienced with WordPress Full Site Editing (FSE)/Block-Based theme development

Solid understanding of and commitment to web standards, including web accessibility standards (WCAG)

Familiar with important WordPress security concepts

Familiarity with package managers for PHP (Composer) and JS (NPM/Yarn)

Familiarity with PSR specifications

Previous working experience with Code versioning and code review

Previous working experience with Docker, Git, and dependency management via Composer

Optimizing sites for performance

Interacting with REST API/ GraphQL

Manage and sustain multiple projects at once while working cross-functionally across business and IT teams

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Attention NJ Applicants: In April 2020, our Company announced plans to consolidate our New Jersey campuses into a single New Jersey headquarters location in Rahway, NJ by 2023. Therefore, the NJ work location for this role will be temporarily based and the exact timing of the departmental move to Rahway, NJ will be communicated at a future date.

Associate Director, Lead Cloud Engineer will work within the Human Health Insights, Analytics and Data area to contribute to development of our advanced data science application platform. We are realizing the vision of a cohesive commercial decision support suite, helping stakeholders make data-driven decisions to optimize delivery of our product to patients. The candidate will work with the Solutions Engineering team to architect and implement highly available and performant solutions using AWS cloud, Kubernetes, and AWS AI/ML services.

The Lead Cloud Engineer role requires excellent programming skills in Python and thorough knowledge of CI/CD, containerization, and implementation of cloud-based architecture. The candidate will be focused on developing reproduceable, scalable, and testable pipelines to create our infrastructure and test and deploy our code, and to expose advanced capabilities to our systems.

The preferred candidate will have an entrepreneurial spirit, understanding of healthcare & technology, a demonstrated record of leading / guiding / mentoring / managing teams to design and build solutions preferably using AWS cloud platform services. The candidate will have demonstrated consistently strong leadership skills, an ability to work independently and deal well with ambiguity and strong collaboration skills. The candidate will empower a growth mindset and inspire a culture of continual learning. This role will require interfacing and collaborating with many teams throughout a lot of our Company’s market and so strong communication skills is a must.


Lead DevOps and Cloud engineering activities for our products, from quick prototypes to extensive applications.

Build and lead a new team of engineers to execute our product vision

Improve and standardize our CI/CD workflow across our product suite

Build and maintain highly available, scalable, and secure infrastructure in AWS using scripting and Infrastructure-as-Code tools

Improve cost and efficiency of existing infrastructure in AWS using auto-scaling and dynamic provisioning of resources

Analyze system performance, resource utilization and troubleshoot any issues.

Lead, Develop, and influence software development patterns and standards

Provide technical guidance, mentoring, and leadership to other team members

Conduct code reviews, ensure changes enhance maintainability, performance, and security

Analyze and improve efficiency and scalability of systems and processes

Help develop our analytics product platform, align the architecture of our products to leverage, to improve quality and reuse.

Collaborate on idea generation, definition, and construction with teams across the company

Learn about the newest techniques and technologies and share with others to improve our team culture and ways of working


A minimum of BS (or equivalent) in Data Science, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, IT, or an equivalent scientific/commercial discipline. Masters/PhD preferred.


5+ years experience building and delivering production quality systems on the cloud

Excellent software engineering and debugging skills

Advanced experience developing with cloud services, e.g. AWS EKS, Fargate, Lambda, Sagemaker, Glue, etc

Strong understanding of AWS best practices, including networking, IAM, monitoring, logging, tracing.

Advanced experience with containers and orchestration, preferably with Kubernetes

Advanced experience using cloud platforms and APIs

Advanced experience with Linux/Unix, systems administration

Strong experience with Python

Experience in technical guidance, mentoring, leadership

Strong understanding of application security

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Strong teamwork ethic, passion for learning and desire to seek new challenges

Experience leading team in an agile structure and reporting to senior leadership.

Demonstrated ability to collaborate with diverse groups of work colleagues and positively manage ambiguity.

Self-motivation, proactivity, and ability to work independently with minimum direction.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to communicate appropriately and confidently with colleagues from different backgrounds and seniority levels.

Excellent organizational skills, with ability to navigate a complex matrix environment and organize/prioritize work efficiently and effectively.

Proven track record of successful completion of multi-stakeholder projects necessitating coordination cross-functionally between several departments.

Our Human Health Division maintains a “patient first, profits later” ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

6+ months of experience in IT field and/or related program

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description
Our Quantitative Sciences team uses big data to analyze the safety and efficacy claims of our potential medical breakthroughs. We review the quality and reliability of clinical studies using deep scientific knowledge, statistical analysis and high-quality data to support decision making in clinical trials.
The Associate Principal Scientist, Statistical Programming-Oncology leads the statistical programming activities for multiple and/or large/complex late stage drug/vaccine clinical development projects. Accountability predominantly includes the development and execution of statistical analysis and reporting deliverables (e.g., safety and efficacy analysis datasets, tables, listings, figures), the span of which range from individual clinical trials to world-wide regulatory application submissions and post marketing support. Key areas of focus include: (1) the assurance of deliverable quality and process compliance, (2) effective deliverable development utilizing global and therapeutic area (TA) standards that optimize analysis and reporting and promote a strategic knowledge-base data model, (3) maintaining and managing a project plan including resource forecasting, (4) coordinating the activities of a global programming team that includes outsource provider staff, and (5) membership on departmental strategic initiative project teams such as new statistical computing platform evaluation and development.

Job Description

The Principal Statistical Programmer, SDTM, focuses on strategic activities impacting creation of SDTM deliverables for analysis and reporting and world-wide regulatory application submissions of drug and vaccine clinical development projects to the direct benefit of clinical development project teams.

The position is a key collaborator with internal and external stakeholders including Statistical Programming, Statistics, Regulatory, Data Management, Clinical and other project stakeholders.

Accountability predominantly includes creation and validation of SDTM data deliverables (SDTM dataset, Define.XML, SDRG, aCRF), collaborating and consulting with project teams, outreach to external vendors and partners, and keeping current with industry submission data standards.


Address operational challenges that require strategic solutions resulting in improved regulatory submissions in both timeliness and quality.

Oversight of SDTM deliverable creation for A&R and submission including up-versioning.

Oversight of the use of Pinnacle 21 Enterprise to ensure compliance of CRT deliverables.

Leadership in industry teams and conferences on best practices.

Leadership on departmental strategic initiative project teams.


BA/BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Life Sciences, Engineering or related field plus 12-15 years SAS programming experience in a clinical trial environment.

MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Life Sciences, Engineering or related field plus 10 or more years SAS programming experience in a clinical trial environment.


Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to negotiate and collaborate effectively.

Excellent written, oral, and presentation skills.

Superior knowledge and significant experience in setting strategy and developing SDTM and analysis and reporting deliverables for R&D projects (data, analyses, tables, graphics, listings).

Excellent project management skills; leadership across multiple and complex programs; determines approach and ensures consistency and directs effort others; ability to engage key stakeholders.


US and/or worldwide drug or vaccine regulatory application submission experience at the leadership level including the development of electronic submission deliverables.

Superior knowledge with submission standards CDISC (SDTM, ADaM), Define.XML, SDRG, ADRG, aCRF.

Demonstrated success in the assurance of deliverable quality and process compliance.

Excels in technical writing, able to convert complex ideas and information into simple readable form.

Excellent project management skills.

Familiarity with clinical data management concepts.

Strategic thinking - ability to analyze operational activities and challenges and develop and implement strategic solutions.

Ability to anticipate stakeholder requirements.


Experience in process assessment, improvement and operational excellence methodologies.

Strong working knowledge of reporting processes (SOPs) and software development life-cycle (SDLC).

Experience providing technical and/or programming guidance and mentoring to colleagues.

Deals well with change and seamlessly assimilates to new projects and stakeholders.

Ability and interest to work across cultures and geographies.

Ability to complete statistical programming deliverables through the use of global outsource partner programming staff.

Experience developing and managing a project plan using Microsoft Project or similar package.

Active in professional societies.

Experience with Meta Data Repositories.

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our Quantitative Sciences team uses big data to analyze the safety and efficacy claims of our potential medical breakthroughs. We review the quality and reliability of clinical studies using deep scientific knowledge, statistical analysis and high-quality data to support decision making in clinical trials.

The Associate Principal Scientist, Statistical Programming-Oncology leads the statistical programming activities for multiple and/or large/complex late stage drug/vaccine clinical development projects. Accountability predominantly includes the development and execution of statistical analysis and reporting deliverables (e.g., safety and efficacy analysis datasets, tables, listings, figures), the span of which range from individual clinical trials to world-wide regulatory application submissions and post marketing support. Key areas of focus include: (1) the assurance of deliverable quality and process compliance, (2) effective deliverable development utilizing global and therapeutic area (TA) standards that optimize analysis and reporting and promote a strategic knowledge-base data model, (3) maintaining and managing a project plan including resource forecasting, (4) coordinating the activities of a global programming team that includes outsource provider staff, and (5) membership on departmental strategic initiative project teams such as new statistical computing platform evaluation and development.

Additional Responsibilities

Design and maintenance of statistical databases that support multiple stakeholder groups which include clinical development, outcomes research and safety evaluation

Key collaborator with statistics and other project stakeholders in ensuring that project plans are executed efficiently with timely and high quality deliverables

Serves as the statistical programming point of contact and knowledge holder through the entire product lifecycle for assigned projects

Education Requirements

BA/BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Life Sciences, Engineering or related field plus 9-12 years SAS programming experience in a clinical trial environment

MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Life Sciences, Engineering or related field plus 7 or more years SAS programming experience in a clinical trial environment

Experience and Skills

Required

Directing large and/or complex statistical programming projects that include coordinating the activities of a programming team

Expansive knowledge and significant experience in developing analysis and reporting statistical programming deliverables (datasets, statistical analyses, report tables, and graphics) using global and TA standards and according to quality, compliance and timeliness requirements

Expertise in SAS and clinical trial programming including data steps, procedures, MACRO, SAS/GRAPH; systems and database expertise | Familiarity with statistical analysis methods and clinical data management concepts

United States and/or worldwide drug or vaccine regulatory application submission knowledge at the leadership level including the development of electronic submission deliverables.

Strategic, effective and strong project management skills

Program Leader who establishes appropriate programming methodology, assures programming consistency across protocols and projects, completes programming tasks, and directs the program development effort of other programmers; an experienced programming mentor; ability to engage key stakeholders

Ability to comprehend statistical analysis plans which may describe statistical methodology to be programmed

Comprehension of statistical terminology and concepts Designs and develops complex programming algorithms

Principled and effective communication and negotiation skills with a demonstrated history of teamwork and collaboration; deals well with change and seamlessly assimilates to new projects and stakeholders

Strategic thinking - ability to turn strategy into tactical activities; design of statistical databases with the end in mind that optimize analysis and reporting and leverage departmental standards and industry best-practices

CDISC and ADaM standards skills

Demonstrated success in the assurance of deliverable quality and process compliance

Ability to anticipate stakeholder and regulatory requirements

Preferred

Strong working knowledge of reporting processes, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and software development life-cycle (SDLC)

Ability and interest to work across cultures and geographies

Providing technical and/or programming guidance and mentoring to colleagues

Ability to complete statistical programming deliverables through the use of global outsource partner programming staff

Developing and managing a project plan using Microsoft Project or similar package

Active in professional societies

Process improvement

We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” and that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. And we believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

The Automation/IT capital project delivery, will be responsible for delivery of Automation and IT scope on one or more projects in the portfolio of capital projects (total project value up to $200MM) managed by Global Engineering Solutions (GES), for Human Health or our Research & Development Division facilities. The incumbent will partner with stakeholders in the business, GES and Digital our Manufacturing Division Product Teams to ensure that projects are correctly scoped and delivered with appropriate technology and qualification standards. The incumbent may be accountable for finance, staffing and delivery of the end-to-end scope. Alternatively, on larger projects, the incumbent may serve in a Technical Lead role, with a dotted line reporting relationship to the Automation/IT Project Manager.

The Automation Eng / Project Mgr is responsible for activities that may include the following:

Partner with local business leadership and project teams to scope for Automation and IT aspects of capital projects, bringing knowledge of Automation technologies and the Manufacturing Systems Architecture

Financial accountability for Automation / IT Spend (typically in the range of 6-8% of total project capital cost)

Understand and educate local project teams on automation standards as they relate to technology selection, system configuration, SDLC (System Development Life Cycle), validation, hardware, software environments and business processes.

Develop and execute project staffing plans if required.

Close liaison with Process Engineering Lead and A/E firm/EPCM

Drive efficiencies in execution of projects to reduce costs and cycle times based on standards

Engages with stakeholders at all levels of projects, including active participation in Project Core teams

Ensures that our Company SDLC is appropriately applied


Bachelors degree (Prefer BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or other technical degree)


7 + years of working experience in capital project process automation or ongoing site automation support

Previous working experience analyzing and defining business problems, developing business cases, and identifying appropriate process and technological solutions

Excellent facilitation, problem solving, and decision-making skills

Excellent written and oral communication skills


DeltaV experience

MS in Engineering, Computer Science or related field/MBA

Proven record of proficiencies associated with business analysis on small sized projects. Excellent understanding of cGMP's, SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) methodologies and Lean/MPS/ Six Sigma principles.

Strong presentation skills

Proven facilitation, meeting/workshop management, project management and change management skills.

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

The Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) is a crucial member of Foundational Automation to deliver dependable platforms for our intelligent automation products. They will be part of a world class SRE team focusing on designing and building automation platforms at scale. These platforms will be used to deploy business applications that support the research and development, manufacturing, and sales of medicines that save and improve the lives of patients around the world.

As a steward of availability, scalability, and performance, they will work alongside other engineers to monitor cloud-based platforms as well as identifying performance bottlenecks. Site Reliability Engineers provide day-to-day technical support for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operations of business applications. They plan, design, implement, manage and maintain these systems in the cloud. They will manage system availability, capacity, incident handling, problem resolution and asset lifecycle management. Lastly, they will develop and execute business continuity, high availability, and disaster recovery protocols.

The candidate must have a methodical approach to problem-solving, exceptional customer empathy, excellent communication skills, practical debugging abilities, and familiarity with contemporary SRE procedures. The ideal applicant should be knowledgeable about dev-ops procedures and the complete software development lifecycle. The ideal candidate should not only have great technical abilities but also a strong predisposition for action, be flexible, and display an unrestrained entrepreneurial spirit with a can-do mentality.

The Site Reliability Engineer will report to the Foundational Automation SRE Technical Lead.

Key Responsibilities

Design and build infrastructure services, systems, and platforms running Windows 2019.

Develop tools, automation, and monitor to operate infrastructure efficiently

Work in a fast-paced environment and responsible for end-to-end production environment by responding to performance and reliability issues; including participating in rotational on-call shifts

Perform preventative and corrective maintenance and provide technical support as required, including system diagnostic, monitoring, and health checks

Provide regular reports on infrastructure performance statistics and inventory

Conduct annual security testing on infrastructure, execute disaster recovery and business continuity plans.

Manage external vendors and contractors to timely delivery and implement technologies or solutions

Software delivery, site reliability and/or database/network administration for commercial large-scale software and services.

Coding and debugging

Monitoring, implementing and maintaining cloud offerings such as Azure and AWS

Excellent communication skills. The person will own communicating complex live site issues and metrics to key internal and external stakeholders

Skills

Proficient in cloud computing, infrastructure as code, cloud-native principles & microservices design

Highly capable problem solver able to map the best technology available to the business needs in an elegant comprehensive solution design

Effective communicator able to gain alignment, ensure clarity, and explain complex principles

Able to manage a complex engineering organizational that adapts and scales to the business need

Capable technical mentor and career guide

Ability to understand technical demands of a solution and map the relevant engineer skills to ensure optimal assignments across diverse teams and initiatives

Technology Service Management

Incident Management

Change Control

IT Infrastructure

Experience

4+ years preferred, but will consider 2+ years of hands-on experience in Site Reliability, DevOps and/or Software Engineering for commercial large scale cloud software or services

Strong understanding of Windows Admin activities & batch scripting is a plus

Experience with MS-SQL database admin tasks & patching

Good understanding of public cloud offerings such as Azure and/or AWS.

AWS services such as EC2, Lambda, S3, Cloud formation, CloudFront, VPC, EBS, Auto-scaling, Dynamo DB etc.

Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform or other Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD

Experience with coding languages (C++, C#, Java, .NET, Golang) and proficiency in debugging, and live-site troubleshooting during an outage

Background in monitoring, disaster recovery, and automation

Our ideal candidate will demonstrate strong customer empathy, show a strong bias for action, be adaptable and possess strong interpersonal skills

Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science, statistics, engineering, mathematics, data science, or a related field

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Associate Director, Lead Backend Engineer will work within the Human Health Insights, Analytics and Data area to contribute to development of our advanced data science application platform. We are realizing the vision of a cohesive commercial decision support suite, helping stakeholders make data-driven decisions to optimize delivery of our product to patients. The candidate will work with the Solutions Engineering team to architect and implement highly available and performant solutions using AWS cloud, Kubernetes, and AWS AI/ML services.

The Lead Backend Engineer role requires excellent programming skills in Python and thorough knowledge of CI/CD, containerization, and implementation of cloud-based architecture.

The preferred candidate will have an entrepreneurial spirit, understanding of healthcare & technology, a demonstrated record of leading / guiding / mentoring / managing teams to design and build solutions preferably using AWS cloud platform services. The candidate will have demonstrated consistently strong leadership skills, an ability to work independently and deal well with ambiguity and strong collaboration skills. The candidate will empower a growth mindset and inspire a culture of continual learning. This role will require interfacing and collaborating with many teams throughout a lot of our company's markets and so strong communication skills is a must.


Lead backend engineering activities for our product suite, from quick prototypes to extensive web-based applications.

Build and lead a new team of engineers to execute our product vision

Work with the DevOps/Cloud team to Build and maintain highly available, scalable, and secure infrastructure in AWS using scripting and Infrastructure -as-Code tools

Contribute to design and use of APIs to expose backend functionality

Reassess our products frequently to enhance and align architectures, knowledge models, user experience, performance, and stability.

Lead, Develop, and influence software development patterns and standards

Provide technical guidance, mentoring, and leadership to other team members

Conduct code reviews, ensure changes enhance maintainability, performance, and security

Analyze and improve efficiency and scalability of systems and processes

Help develop our analytics product platform, align the architecture of our products to leverage, to improve quality and reuse.

Collaborate with DevOps team to implement CI/CD release workflow

Collaborate on idea generation, definition, and construction with teams across the company

Learn about the newest techniques and technologies and share with others to improve our team culture and ways of working


A minimum of BS (or equivalent) in Data Science, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, IT, or an equivalent scientific/commercial discipline. Masters/PhD preferred.


5+ years experience building and delivering production quality systems

Excellent software engineering and debugging skills

Advanced experience with Python and microservices

Advanced experience with containers and orchestration, preferably with Kubernetes

Advanced experience using cloud platforms and API development

Experience developing with cloud services, e.g. AWS Lambda, Sagemaker, Glue, or other

Experience with data pipelines, relational and NoSQL databases

Advanced experience with Linux/Unix

Exposure to BI tools a plus (PowerBI, SpotFire, Tableau, etc)

Strong understanding of application security

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Strong teamwork ethic, passion for learning and desire to seek new challenges

Experience leading team in an agile structure and reporting to senior leadership.

Demonstrated ability to collaborate with diverse groups of work colleagues and positively manage ambiguity.

Self-motivation, proactivity, and ability to work independently with minimum direction.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to communicate appropriately and confidently with colleagues from different backgrounds and seniority levels.

Excellent organizational skills, with ability to navigate a complex matrix environment and organize/prioritize work efficiently and effectively.

Proven track record of successful completion of multi-stakeholder projects necessitating coordination cross-functionally between several departments.

Our Human Health Division maintains a “patient first, profits later” ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide.

R208699

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our Quantitative Sciences team uses big data to analyze the safety and efficacy claims of our potential medical breakthroughs. We review the quality and reliability of clinical studies using deep scientific knowledge, statistical analysis and high-quality data to support decision making in clinical trials.

The Associate Principal Scientist, Statistical Programming-Oncology leads the statistical programming activities for multiple and/or large/complex late stage drug/vaccine clinical development projects. Accountability predominantly includes the development and execution of statistical analysis and reporting deliverables (e.g., safety and efficacy analysis datasets, tables, listings, figures), the span of which range from individual clinical trials to world-wide regulatory application submissions and post marketing support. Key areas of focus include: (1) the assurance of deliverable quality and process compliance, (2) effective deliverable development utilizing global and therapeutic area (TA) standards that optimize analysis and reporting and promote a strategic knowledge-base data model, (3) maintaining and managing a project plan including resource forecasting, (4) coordinating the activities of a global programming team that includes outsource provider staff, and (5) membership on departmental strategic initiative project teams such as new statistical computing platform evaluation and development.

Additional Responsibilities

Design and maintenance of statistical databases that support multiple stakeholder groups which include clinical development, outcomes research and safety evaluation

Key collaborator with statistics and other project stakeholders in ensuring that project plans are executed efficiently with timely and high quality deliverables

Serves as the statistical programming point of contact and knowledge holder through the entire product lifecycle for assigned projects


BA/BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Life Sciences, Engineering or related field plus 9-12 years SAS programming experience in a clinical trial environment

MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Life Sciences, Engineering or related field plus 7 or more years SAS programming experience in a clinical trial environment


Directing large and/or complex statistical programming projects that include coordinating the activities of a programming team

Expansive knowledge and significant experience in developing analysis and reporting statistical programming deliverables (datasets, statistical analyses, report tables, and graphics) using global and TA standards and according to quality, compliance and timeliness requirements

Expertise in SAS and clinical trial programming including data steps, procedures, MACRO, SAS/GRAPH; systems and database expertise | Familiarity with statistical analysis methods and clinical data management concepts

United States and/or worldwide drug or vaccine regulatory application submission knowledge at the leadership level including the development of electronic submission deliverables.

Strategic, effective and strong project management skills

Program Leader who establishes appropriate programming methodology, assures programming consistency across protocols and projects, completes programming tasks, and directs the program development effort of other programmers; an experienced programming mentor; ability to engage key stakeholders

Ability to comprehend statistical analysis plans which may describe statistical methodology to be programmed

Comprehension of statistical terminology and concepts Designs and develops complex programming algorithms

Principled and effective communication and negotiation skills with a demonstrated history of teamwork and collaboration; deals well with change and seamlessly assimilates to new projects and stakeholders

Strategic thinking - ability to turn strategy into tactical activities; design of statistical databases with the end in mind that optimize analysis and reporting and leverage departmental standards and industry best-practices

CDISC and ADaM standards skills

Demonstrated success in the assurance of deliverable quality and process compliance

Ability to anticipate stakeholder and regulatory requirements


Strong working knowledge of reporting processes, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and software development life-cycle (SDLC)

Ability and interest to work across cultures and geographies

Providing technical and/or programming guidance and mentoring to colleagues

Ability to complete statistical programming deliverables through the use of global outsource partner programming staff

Developing and managing a project plan using Microsoft Project or similar package

Active in professional societies

Process improvement

We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

The Senior Statistical Programmer, Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM), provides oversight and creation of the SDTM deliverables for analysis and reporting and world-wide regulatory application submissions of drug and vaccine clinical development projects. Accountability predominantly includes creation and validation of Case Report Tabulation (SDTM) study data deliverables (SDTM dataset, Define Extensible Markup Language (XML), Study Data Reviewer Guide (SDRG), Annotated Case Report Form (aCRF)), collaborating and consulting with project teams, outreach to external vendors and partners, and keeping current with industry submission data standards.

The incumbent will be responsible for continuous improvement of our electronic submission process for study data standard deliverables and providing tools and templates to support delivery focusing on traceability, quality assurance, data conformance and data fitness. The position is a key collaborator with internal and external stakeholders including Statistical Programming, Statistics, Regulatory, Data Management, Clinical and other project stakeholders.

Primary Responsibilities

Supporting project teams in creating SDTM deliverables for Analysis and Reporting (A&R) and submission

Supporting project teams in preparing submission deliverables including use of Pinnacle 21 Enterprise

Up-versioning activities to specific versions of SDTM

Develop Statistical Analysis System (SAS) programs, standards macros to enhance the process

Collaborate effectively with project team members

Participation in industry teams and conferences on best practices

Membership on departmental strategic initiative project teams

Education Minimum Requirements

Bachelor of Arts or Science (BA/BS) in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Life Sciences, Engineering with a minimum of five (5) years SAS programming experience in a clinical trial environment.

Required Experience and Skills

Experience with study data standards CDISC (SDTM)

Experience in SAS and clinical programming

Knowledge and experience in developing analysis and reporting deliverables for Research & Development projects(data, analysis, tables, graphics, listings)

Excellent communication and negotiation skills / excellent teamwork and collaboration

Excellent written and verbal, and presentation skills; effective technical writing, able to convert complex ideas and information into simple readable form

A project leader; completes tasks independently at a project level; ability to collaborate with key stakeholders

Solid project management skills

Demonstrated success in the assurance of deliverable quality and process compliance

Familiarity with statistical and clinical data management concepts

Preferred Experience and Skills

Strong working knowledge of reporting processes Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) and software development life-cycle (SDLC)

Experience ensuring consistency across protocols and projects

Strategic thinking ability to turn strategy into tactical activities

Ability and interest to work across cultures and geographies

Ability to complete statistical deliverables using global outsource partner programming staff

Experience developing and managing a project plan using Microsoft Project or similar package

Active in industry forums and professional societies

Experience in process improvement

Knowledge of Metadata Repositories (MDR)

Position Description:
Associate Director, Lead Frontend Engineer will work within the Human Health Insights, Analytics and Data area to contribute to development of our advanced data science application platform. We are realizing the vision of a cohesive commercial decision support suite, helping stakeholders make data-driven decisions to optimize delivery of our product to patients. The preferred candidate will have an entrepreneurial spirit, understanding of healthcare & technology, a demonstrated record of leading / guiding / mentoring / managing teams to design and build solutions preferably using AWS cloud platform services. The candidate will have demonstrated consistently strong leadership skills, an ability to work independently and deal well with ambiguity and strong collaboration skills. The candidate will empower a growth mindset and inspire a culture of continual learning. This role will require interfacing and collaborating with many teams throughout a lot of our Company’s markets and so strong communication skills is a must.


Lead frontend engineering activities for all of our products, from quick prototypes to extensive applications.

Build and lead a new team of engineers to execute our product vision

Build and maintain web-based applications across several solution verticals

Lead, Develop, and influence software development patterns and standards

Provide technical guidance, mentoring, and leadership to other team members

Conduct code reviews, ensure changes enhance maintainability, performance, and security

Comfortable wearing many hats and willing to work on all parts of the stack

Solid understanding of and commitment to web standards, including web accessibility standards (WCAG)

We partner with the business to ensure we maintain our company’s values and high ethical standards, comply with the law, protect our people, and enhance our reputation. We strive to foster an environment that is inspiring, supportive, and diverse.

Collaborates with the Learning Experience Architect, Learning Designer and client facing learning professionals to develop engaging, efficient and effective Learning Experiences based on Blueprint and detailed designs to meet stated business outcomes.

Partners with subject matter experts (SMEs) and learners applying learner centric experience design methods (Agile, Design thinking, focus groups, UX research) to curate and/or develop content to develop learning assets identified in the blueprint and learning solution design.

Develops learning solutions based on deep understanding of enterprise and business unit internal trends, learners, organizational culture, personas, mindset and skills, and internal limits including change tolerance, leader availability, learner attention/absorption, incentives, information, tools/resources.

Leverages data driven insights to inform design and development. Recommends appropriate solutions and delivery methods to optimize skill development and behavior changes identified

Develops effective assessment and measurement for learning experiences/solutions.

Researches learning industry trends, methodologies, and best practices and integrates those into professional practice including learning technologies that can increase effectiveness and efficiency.

Adheres to GLD Learning Model principles and standards, guidelines and leverages templates, tools and taxonomies.


Bachelor’s degree in Instructional systems, learning technologies or other related discipline

6+ years of related experience (4+ with Master’s degree), with minimum 3 years of experience developing learning solutions (e.g., videos, editing podcasts, e-learning, instructor led courses, assessments, etc.)

Experience developing multiple learning solution projects and/or programs at once; experience in current and emerging content authoring and development tools and (e.g. Articulate 360, Adobe Creative Suite, Vyond, HTML 5, etc.); e-learning standards and LMS courseware integration with AICC and SCORM

Ability to leverage innovative digital learning technologies and scalable user interfaces for web and mobile learning experiences

Ability to co-create, collaborate and build trusted partnerships with team and business stakeholders

Leverage data driven insights to drive decisions

Agility, flexibility, working in a fast-paced iterative environment

Excellent communication skills, interpersonal skills, analytical/problem solving skills, cross-functional leadership skills

Maintains a strong balance between technology and business acumen with a deep desire to deliver business value to the organization

Ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects simultaneously and independently

Developing blended learning solutions leveraging different learning modalities (e.g. social learning platforms, virtual training, e-learning, classroom training etc.)


Master’s Degree or certification in Instructional Design, education, training, or related field of study

UX design experience for software, web applications which leverage emergent technologies, consumer electronics, and / or mobile devices

Strong conceptualization ability, strong visual communication ability, storyboarding

Ability to create wireframes as well as visual design comps

Understanding of common software project management and development practices

Experience with Graphic Design tools, motion graphic animation, 3D animation, AR/VR tools

Experience with video and sound editing and/or Cinematography

Title: Cloud Web Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our Digital team is innovating how we understand our patients and their needs. Working cross functionally we are inventing new ways of communicating, measuring and interacting with our customers and patients through digital channels and technologies.

Position Description:
Associate Director, Lead Frontend Engineer will work within the Human Health Insights, Analytics and Data area to contribute to development of our advanced data science application platform. We are realizing the vision of a cohesive commercial decision support suite, helping stakeholders make data-driven decisions to optimize delivery of our product to patients. The candidate will work with the Solutions Engineering team to architect and implement highly available and performant solutions using AWS cloud, Kubernetes, and AWS AI/ML services.

Our solutions bring together business, data science, and cloud engineering worlds, and leverage technologies like Jupyter, Vue and React, Voila, Kubernetes, and more. The Lead Frontend Engineer doesn’t need to be an expert in all of these, but should have excellent programming skills and experience in JavaScript and Python and a demonstrated ability to learn and grow.

The preferred candidate will have an entrepreneurial spirit, understanding of healthcare & technology, a demonstrated record of leading / guiding / mentoring / managing teams to design and build solutions preferably using AWS cloud platform services. The candidate will have demonstrated consistently strong leadership skills, an ability to work independently and deal well with ambiguity and strong collaboration skills. The candidate will empower a growth mindset and inspire a culture of continual learning. This role will require interfacing and collaborating with many teams throughout a lot of our Company’s markets and so strong communication skills is a must.


Lead frontend engineering activities for all of our products, from quick prototypes to extensive applications.

Build and lead a new team of engineers to execute our product vision

Build and maintain web-based applications across several solution verticals

Lead, Develop, and influence software development patterns and standards

Provide technical guidance, mentoring, and leadership to other team members

Conduct code reviews, ensure changes enhance maintainability, performance, and security

Analyze and improve efficiency and scalability of systems and processes

Create automated unit tests

Collaborate with DevOps team to implement CI/CD release workflow

Collaborate on idea generation, definition, and construction with teams across the company

Learn about the newest techniques and technologies and share with others to improve our team culture and ways of working



BS (or equivalent) in Data Science, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, IT, or an equivalent scientific/commercial discipline.

Masters/PhD preferred.


5+ years experience building and delivering production quality web applications

Excellent software engineering and debugging skills

Advanced experience with JavaScript and HTML/CSS

Advanced experience with Python, preferably also with the IPyWidgets and Jupyter ecosystem, Flask/Django, etc.

Deep knowledge of at least one modern JavaScript framework such as React or Vue

Experience building web applications from scratch while working with a variety of full-stack tools and technologies

Experience using cloud platforms and RESTful APIs

Exposure to BI tools a plus (PowerBI, SpotFire, Tableau, etc)

Experience in technical guidance, mentoring, leadership

Strong understanding of application security

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Strong teamwork ethic, passion for learning and desire to seek new challenges

Experience leading team in an agile structure and reporting to senior leadership.

Demonstrated ability to collaborate with diverse groups of work colleagues and positively manage ambiguity.

Self-motivation, proactivity, and ability to work independently with minimum direction.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to communicate appropriately and confidently with colleagues from different backgrounds and seniority levels.

Excellent organizational skills, with ability to navigate a complex matrix environment and organize/prioritize work efficiently and effectively.

Proven track record of successful completion of multi-stakeholder projects necessitating coordination cross-functionally between several departments.

Our Human Health Division maintains a “patient first, profits later” ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Title: Associate Director, Lead UI/UX Designer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Attention NJ Applicants: In April 2020, our Company announced plans to consolidate our New Jersey campuses into a single New Jersey headquarters location in Rahway, NJ by 2023. Therefore, the NJ work location for this role will be temporarily based and the exact timing of the departmental move to Rahway, NJ will be communicated at a future date.

Associate Director, Lead UI/UX Designer will work within the Human Health Insights, Analytics and Data area to contribute to development of our advanced data science application platform. We are realizing the vision of a cohesive commercial decision support suite, helping stakeholders make data-driven decisions to optimize delivery of our product to patients. The candidate will lead UI/UX design and the evolution of a consistent design language to apply across our Company’s commercial analytics application suite, ensuring usability and consistency.

The preferred candidate will work closely with business users to understand their needs, conduct listening workshops, propose UX concepts and evaluate responses. The candidate will team up with front end developers to build the solutions and should have experience translating design concepts to technical requirements language and understanding of the capabilities and limitations of implementation technologies. This role will require collaborating with cross-functional teams around the globe, strong communication skills is a must.


Lead development of master design guide for user-centric commercial analytics solutions.

Collaborate with frontend engineering team to translate designs to functional applications.

Conduct workshops to develop user requirements, wireframes, and UI prototypes.

Apply best practices in UX design to continuously improve upon intuitive user experience for business stakeholders.

Thought leadership in quantitative UX practices, incorporation to improve designs.

Lead and grow solutions UX team to continue improvement of our solutions suite.


A minimum of BS (or equivalent) in Human-Computer Interaction, Information Design, Graphic Design, or a related design or behavioral science discipline, or equivalent experience.


Have a portfolio that demonstrates a customer-centered approach to design, care in craft, and well thought through, end-to-end experiences

5+ years of product design experience

3+ years of shipping product experiences

Passion for user-centered design

Strong attention to detail

Natural entrepreneur

Strong communication skills with an ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners (Design, Product, Engineering, Marketing)

Ability to support UX research

HTML, CSS + JS are a plus

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Excellent organizational skills, with ability to navigate a complex matrix environment and organize/prioritize work efficiently and effectively

Demonstrated ability to collaborate and lead with diverse groups of work colleagues and positively manage ambiguity

Experience in Pharma and or Biotech Industry is a plus

Title: Senior Specialist, Mobile App Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description

New hires based in the US & Puerto Rico will be required to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for a medical or religious exemption or accommodation to this vaccination requirement, subject to applicable law.

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

The Digital Marketing Solutions team part of the Global AH IT team is looking for a Sr. Specialist Mobile App Analyst to join the Digital Marketing Solutions team. Responsibilities include managing the release of Animal Health’s internal and external iPhone and Android applications; providing consultation to our suppliers to troubleshoot and resolve development and publication issues; reporting and analytics for internal and external mobile apps; liaison with Apple and Google’s review teams; working with other teams in the company to establish quality guidelines; ensuring that mobile apps meet company’s compliance and technical requirements. The position will require mobile development experience and the ability to understand, build, and troubleshoot code from our suppliers, but the mobile app technical lead will not be developing mobile applications themselves. As the position involves providing guidance to other teams and active collaboration with both technical and non-technical personnel, solid technical and non-technical communication skills will be required to succeed.


Review all new mobile app project demand. This is to ensure project fits within our technology stack. The mobile app technical lead involves collaborating with regional IT, agencies, business owners, and other DMS team members. Be an influencer in designing the right technical approach both from an industry standard and from company/DMS guidelines for app development.

internally to our internal Apps store, and externally to the App Store and Google Play Store.

Management and organization of app source code using our BitBucket GIT repository.

Management of users for agencies to ensure appropriate repository access rights.

Submission of compiled code to our vulnerability scanning tool(s), and providing remediation advice to development teams (with assistance from the ITRMS AppSec team).

Compiling apps for testing on approved Merck UAT testing platforms such as MS AppCenter.

Management of Digital Marketing Services’ Apple and Google Play Store accounts, including developer accounts. Including, but not limited to: creating/managing app ids, entitlements, provisioning profiles, signing certificates and keystores; creating store listings; submitting builds for review by Apple/Google; managing TestFlight/Google Play Test channels; and functioning as the liaison between our company and Apple/Google to resolve issues.

Liaison with other teams for release and management of internal applications to the Apps store, including change management administration.

Ensuring apps meet compliance, branding, and security reviews prior to release, including providing suitability advice on future application plans.

Updating the in-house asset management system (WebUniverse) with mobile application details.

Responsible for managing the app analytics and reporting. This includes:

Setting up application projects and providing Firebase configuration files to dev teams.

Setting up Google Firebase analytics reporting for app owners.

Run customized reports as/when requested for certain time periods.

Providing reports from App Store and Google Play Store statistics.

Technical Consultant to App Developers

Supporting agencies and troubleshooting with development issues that may occur, including providing advice based on source code reviews, black box, grey box, or white box testing.

Providing advice/recommending solutions for issues that may be reported during the vulnerability scanning process.

Providing input to agency partners on the implementation of development best practices during the mobile app development lifecycle

Providing advice on types of technologies accepted, and consulting with agencies on development capabilities. This includes working directly with an agency’s app developers to ensure suitability and quality.

Providing cross-platform support and creating builds from multiple different technologies.

Providing implementation advice to agencies and others on consuming remote APIs and web services. A familiarity with the processes involved in back-end server development, including suitable technologies and methodologies is required.

Team collaborator for process improvements

Providing an assessment of our current mobile app governance model to identify possible enhancements and implementation advice.

Contributing to an overall strategy for management of our mobile portfolio.

Assist in implementing maintenance program for all in-scope mobile apps, including on-going support.

Managing the mobile app certification program for agencies, including technical triage and feedback, performance scoring and overall evaluation. This will require a knowledge of software development best practices, as well as mobile app development best practices, as well as experience with meeting current Apple and Google publication requirements.


Bachelor’s Degree

At least 2 years’ professional experience is required developing or QA of applications with: Swift, Java, Kotlin,

Up to 2 years or greater of professional experience developing or QA of applications with Xamarin (.Net) and React-Native.

Unity

Our Animal Health Division is a trusted global leader in veterinary medicine, dedicated to preserving and improving health, well-being, and performance of animals and the people who care for them. We are a global team of professionals working together to make a positive difference in animal care and the world’s food supply and have a deep sense of responsibility towards our customers, consumers, animals, society, and our planet.

Through our commitment to The Science of Healthier Animals®, we offer veterinarians, farmers, pet owners and governments one of the widest ranges of veterinary pharmaceuticals, vaccines and health management solutions and services as well as an extensive suite of digitally connected identification, traceability and monitoring products. We invest in dynamic and comprehensive R&D resources and a modern, global supply chain. We are present in more than 50 countries, while our products are available in some 150 markets.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Title: Cloud Transformation Program Manager
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

Under the direction of the Associate Vice President, Cloud and Infrastructure Technologies, the candidate is responsible for overseeing our Company's enterprise cloud transformation program called “BlueSky”. This will include, but is not limited to the following:

Set goals, initiate and manage programs aligned with the strategic objectives of our Company, the IT organization, and other Enterprise transformation programs

Plan and execute programs from start to completion involving management of deadlines, milestones, blocker resolution, risk management, and all relevant processes

Effectively coordinate activities leveraging agile project execution methodologies

Guide teams to improve Agile maturity and manage program level Agile KPIs

Develop and manage $50+ million dollar program-level budgets and operations for both our Company resources and 3rd party partners

Devise evaluation strategies to monitor program performance, transformational objective achievement, and help identify improvement opportunities

Develop trusted relationships with peer organizations and stakeholders globally

Coordinate all program and project managers involved to provide feedback and resolve complex problems across multiple organizations

Discover, recommend, and implement enhancements to relevant processes and procedures to improve efficiency and productivity of delivery teams

Ensure program operations and activities adhere to legal guidelines and internal policies

Apply risk-based decision making to complex problems and consult with relevant subject matter advisors as needed to inform the decision

Compile and review reports prepared by program participants to determine progress, identify issues, and help ensure quality outcomes

Prepare program communications for consumption by a diverse set of stakeholders and interested parties

Prepare and deliver executive level status reports and communicate complex topics effectively to a diverse executive audience

Position Qualifications

B.A./B.S. or equivalent experience required; Computer Information Sciences, Business Management, or related field; Advanced degree is a plus.

Required Experience and Skills

10+ years experience as program director or other managerial position overseeing diverse teams, complex financials, and enterprise programs

Thorough understanding of both waterfall and agile project/program management techniques and methods

Experience with program level performance evaluation techniques and key metrics

Ability to perform project-related data analysis, reporting and budgeting

Working knowledge modern collaboration tools (Microsoft and Atlassian)

Excellent organizational and leadership skills

Demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with a variety of audiences and stakeholders including, but not limited to executive management, business leaders, IT peers, and colleagues worldwide

Demonstrated leadership in achieving shared objectives in a matrix organization, managing cross-divisional initiatives, and cross-functional teams in an extremely dynamic environment

Results-orientation with the proven ability and reputation for developing plans and implementing them successfully

Demonstrated ability to manage strategic relationship with 3rd party providers on a global basis

Preferred Experience and Skills

General understanding of cloud computing and IT infrastructure technologies and terminology

Familiarity with information security concepts and requirements

Familiarity with GxP systems and related compliance requirements

Title: Cloud Transformation Program Manager
Job_Description:
Job Description

At our Company, we are leveraging analytics and technology, as we invent for life on behalf of patients around the world. We are seeking those who have a passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision making, that will allow us to tackle some of the world’s greatest health threats.

Within our commercial Insights, Analytics, and Data organization we are transforming to better power decision-making across our end-to-end commercialization process, from business development to late lifecycle management. As we endeavor, we are seeking a dynamic talent to be a Founder and serve in the role of Human Health Insights, Analytics & Data (HHIAD) Operational Excellence Program Management Lead.

In this capacity, this role will help HHIAD realize the aspiration for the Operational Excellence capability. This individual will help to ensure a One HHIAD approach, in close collaboration with our Company and leaders across the Globe. This leader will help establish systems and processes that will drive culture, ways of working, and seamless execution of cross-cutting enablers.

Specifically, the HHIAD Operational Excellence Program Management Lead will:

Lead the Program Management capability and team.

Partner with the Capability Portfolio Leaders, Team Leaders, and Partners to:

Define and create overarching organizational program management principles.

Create standards and processes for data and analytic projects utilizing digital and visualization footprints that are cross-cutting for HHIAD and create mechanisms to ensure visibility and easy access.

Build an Agile team to deliver on data and analytics project use cases.

Mentor and guide project managers and Agile team.

Drive solutions to blockers, risk and issues on all programs.

Track and manage portfolio programs and projects.

Define metrics and KPIs aligned to HHIAD program goals.

Manage complexity and change as goals are realigned.

Develop standard templates and utilize tools creating efficiencies and automation of scale.

Make effective decisions when presented with multiple options for how to progress projects.

Communicate with HHIAD Leaders to keep the project aligned with the capability goals.

Perform quality control on projects throughout development to maintain the standards expected.

Streamline existing processes.

Lead Operational Management Review (OMR) portfolio health status utilizing digital and visualization techniques and methods.

Partner with the HHIAD India Operations & Delivery Lead to ensure HHIAD India is executing in alignment with the overarching Program Management processes.

Develop and deliver project management training to drive Change Management partnering with the Communications Leader.

Establish a forward-looking strategy to continue to progress the transformation and the execution of Operational Excellence.


Bachelor’s degree with experience in data and analytics delivery.

10+yrs knowledge of delivering data and analytics complex Agile programs, with proven ability to apply project, or program management frameworks and techniques.

8+ years developing project management processes.

Led a team of 5-10 people program and/or project managers.

Ability to multi-task and provide quick solutions.

Worked across Global teams, multiple stakeholders in a Product Owner Model.

PMI Certified or equivalent experience.

SAFe, Scrum and Six Sigma certification, or experience.

Executive communication skills, and ability to synthesize program status, risks, and interdependencies.

Power BI usage experience and metrics requirements.

Proficient with Microsoft Suite, Teams, Channels, and SharePoint; Jira.

Demonstrated ability to solution, anticipate and be proactive.


Data and analytics business acumen.

CI/CD pipeline using PM Agile tools and methodology.

Healthcare / Biopharma experience.

Our Human Health Division maintains a “patient first, profits later” ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Title: Cloud Transformation Program Manager
Job_Description:
A career with MilliporeSigma is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 60,300 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in Healthcare, Life Science and Electronics. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others. MilliporeSigma is a business of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany.

Your Role:
The Indianapolis Site (Exelead) has witnessed substantial growth in number of client programs managed and number of employees. A Transformation project is being initiated as a cross-functional program to stabilize the site operations (supply chain, manufacturing, quality) and to enable future growth. The Control Tower / Program Manager will be responsible for the transformation project as a temporary assignment for 12-18 months and requires being located at the Indianapolis Site, reporting into LSS (Life Science Services) Global Operations.


As Control Tower you will be responsible for complete oversight of the transformation project across different functions and workstreams. As such, you will act as overall program lead, ensuring in time execution of all workstream activities. You will also track progress and de-bottleneck activities, mobilizing resource pools and expertise within Millipore Sigma global network and outside of company. You will be collaborating intensively with the Site LT and all local SMEs involved. Additionally, you will partner closely with global functions within Millipore Sigma, LSS and SAC and various Group Functions such as HR and Finance.

Workstreams of the transformation project include: Quality, Manufacturing, Process Development, Supply Chain, Engineering, Project Management, Training, Site Engagement.

Title: LATAM HR Services Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description
The HR Service Delivery Analyst will support the LATAM (Latin America) region in providing Tier 2 escalation support for HRSC (Human Resource Service Center) / Data Transactions and Tier 3 support for LATAM related escalations (i.e. language specific needs, country nuances). The HR Service Delivery Analyst will manage Service Delivery mailbox for client escalations, trouble shoot system issues with suppliers (i.e., Workday, ADP), manage and reconcile error log transactions for Payroll ADP.

The position will also require data analysis, trends, volume discussions with key stakeholders across HR Ops and external suppliers (i.e.: GTA (Global Talent Administration) support, HR Support Center) management of Tier 2 data transactions, downstream notifications and inbox tasks performed by the supplier. HR Support Center & Data Transactions Training and Knowledge Updates (i.e. Work Instructions, SOPs) - HR Library ownership (i.e.: work with IT). Ownership of downstream notifications for SharePoint and Region matrix for letters (i.e., hire, movement) and Manage supplier relationships (i.e. Accenture).

Role Description:
One of the core functions of the Global Supplier Management Group (GSMG) is to conduct effective sourcing work for our Company by executing our end-to-end sourcing process. This includes working with the business stakeholder to understand the needed goods or services, identifying the viable suppliers, conducting the evaluation process via RFX steps, selecting the final suppliers, and then completing the negotiation and formal contracting work. The Associate Specialist, Business Performance Analyst monitors performance across activities by liaising with various teams to create and develop material on performance of business for management review and develop wireframe, user-approved data models and, interactive visualization dashboards and reports to support management decisions to gain insights.

Create modeling tools / templates and identifies ways for continuous improvement

Check workflow daily for tasks assigned and redirect work items as appropriate

Create tools, reports and visual dashboards to facilitate insight driven opportunity assessment for the business

Up to Two years in data & analytics roles within finance or procurement or related supply chain role
